p: Data gathered from the literature [ 9, 13– 30] revealed that all mosquito traits relevant to transmission—biting rate, egg-to-adult survival and development rate, adult lifespan, and fecundity—respond strongly to temperature and peak between 23°C and 34°C for the two mosquito species ( Ae. aegypti in Fig 1 and Ae. albopictus in Fig A in S1 Text). DENV extrinsic incubation and vector competence peak at 35°C [ 31– 37] and 31–32°C [ 31, 32, 34, 38], respectively, in both mosquitoes—temperatures at which mosquito survival is low, limiting transmission potential ( Fig 1, Fig A in S1 Text). Appropriate thermal response data were not available for CHIKV and ZIKV extrinsic incubation and vector competence.
